intro: Spergularia nebreana, commonly known as the sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically alternate, linear, and covered in fine hairs. Spergularia nebreana is adapted to harsh environments, making it an important pioneer species in ecological succession.
